domain
Class Scenario

java.lang.Object
  domain.Sprite
      domain.Inanimated
          domain.Scenario
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, Updatable, Collisionable, Statitzable
public class Scenario
extends Inanimated

This class represents the game Scenario. It will be the "background image". Be care when implementing collisions between other Collisionable instances and the Scenario. Since the Sprite.getCollisionableArea() returns a Rectangle wich represents the whole dimension of a Sprite, if an intersection collision check is made with any Collisionable instance wich is inside the Scenario the result will be true. To keep Scenario collision checkings going on as well as it's needed you will find special methods in the Collisions class.

See Also:
Collisions.checkScenarioLimitsCollision(domain.interfaces.Collisionable, domain.Collisions.CollisionDirection, domain.Scenario), Collisions.checkSurfaceCollisionablesCollision(java.awt.Rectangle, domain.Collisions.CollisionDirection, java.awt.Rectangle), Collisions.checkScenarioCollisionableAreasCollision(domain.interfaces.Collisionable, domain.Collisions.CollisionDirection, domain.Scenario), Collisions.checkScenarioFallingCollisionPlatformGame(domain.interfaces.Collisionable, domain.Scenario)

Constructor Detail

Scenario

public Scenario(java.awt.Point relativeToScreen,
                int width,
                int height,
                int zIndex)
Constructor. It calls super(Point relativeToScreen, int width, int height, int zIndex, Rectangle[] collisionableAreas);. The limits are initialized using the given Point (upper-left corner, so the north and west limits are given), the width (the east limit is given) and the height (the south limit is given)

Parameters:
relativeToScreen - The point at wich the upper-left Scenario sprite corner will be screen allocated.
width - The width of the Scenario sprite
height - The height of the Scenario sprite
zIndex - The zIndex of the Scenario sprite

receiveCollisionFromSprite

public void receiveCollisionFromSprite(Sprite sprite,
                                       Collisions.CollisionType type)
This method actually does nothing. If an operation needs to be performed if the scenario receives a collision, the class should be inherited an the method overriden.

Parameters:
sprite - The Sprite instace causing the collision.
type - The CollisionType caused

receiveCollisionFromSprite

public void receiveCollisionFromSprite(Sprite sprite,
                                       Collisions.CollisionType type,
                                       Collisions.CollisionDirection direction)
This method actually does nothing. If an operation needs to be performed if the scenario receives a collision, the class should be inherited an the method overriden.

Parameters:
sprite - The Sprite instace causing the collision.
type - The CollisionType caused
direction - The CollisionDirection in wich the collision is caused.

render

public void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
The render method is overriden since a special Scenario rendering is needed if the current Environment is an instance of a DinamicEnvironment. That means the Scenario image is bigger than the game window and so on a special rendering is required to get only a subimage fitting the window in order to avoid the ineficiency caused by rendering the whole Scenario if it's too big.

Specified by:
render in interface Renderable
Overrides:
render in class Sprite
Parameters:
g - The Graphics object wich will perform the rendering.
